snippet: The building collapse in East Harlem instantaneously trapped people in rubble and just as quickly sent residents into the street to help.
abstract: Building collapse in East Harlem following suspected gas explosion trapped people in rubble and just as quickly sent residents into street to help; destruction of buildings, 1644 and 1646 Park Avenue between 116th and 117th Streets, was instantaneous, as was reaction from neighbors and passers-by.

byline.original: By COREY KILGANNON and SARAH MASLIN NIR
byline.contributor:
Reporting on the East Harlem
explosion was contributed
by Al Baker, Alain
Delaquérière, David W.
Dunlap, Stephen Farrell,
Matt Flegenheimer, Sandra
E. Garcia, Michael M. Grynbaum,
Joseph Goldstein,
Javier C. Hernández, Sheelagh
McNeill, Mark Pargas,
William K. Rashbaum, Eli
M. Rosenberg, Nate Schweber,
Michael Schwirtz, Ashley
Southall, Kate Taylor, Julie
Turkewitz and Alex
Vadukul.

lead_paragraph: The building collapse in East Harlem instantaneously trapped people in rubble and just as quickly sent residents into the street to help.

headline.seo: Harlem Explosion Trapped Some and Spurred Others to Help, Witnesses Say
headline.main: Blast ‘Ripped the Stomach Right Out of You’
headline.print_headline: Explosion ‘Ripped the Stomach Right Out of You’; Neighbors Were the First to Help
